channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Seeing the completion of a six-year project in Wales. Jacqui is extolling the virtues of original features in south London and Buckinghamshire.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Charlie Ross heads to Bryn Y Grog Antiques Centre in Wrexham. With expert help on hand from Thomas Forrester and Stephanie Connell, the teams go head-to-head to see who can buy the most profitable three items to take to auction. Charlie hops over the English border to find out about the history of salt production in Cheshire.

channel.title: The Interview
channel.desc: Irvine Welsh's first novel `Trainspotting' achieved cult status and was turned into a hit film. channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Danny Sebastian hopes to strike the right chord when he learns about guitar making or 'lutherie'. In his workshop, Alex Bishop shows Danny how he makes gypsy jazz, acoustic and electric guitars - a process that takes him up to 200 hours. In Carmarthenshire, two teams are tuning up for a battle of the bargains. Sister act Natalie and Victoria are in red, guided by their expert Stephanie Connell. Their opponents in blue are married couple Oliver and Noi, helped by John Cameron.

channel.desc: Steve heads into the heart of the Suriname jungle. He goes in search of poison dart frogs, deadly snakes, and hopes to find the elusive giant river otter.

channel.desc: Time-travel sequel with Marty McFly and the eccentric inventor Doc Brown travelling back and forth in time to stop their nemesis tampering with history. channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: A Coventry mid-terrace has Dion having flashbacks to his childhood, and a former fish-and-chip shop in Cumbria has Martel feeling peckish. There's a bad smell in the air for Martin in the Welsh valleys.

channel.title: Songs of Praise
channel.desc: Claire McCollum meets world-renowned hymn writers and artists Keith and Kristyn Getty to explore their journey of faith, with hymns led by Keith, Kristyn and their band in Lisburn.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: In Buckinghamshire, Jacqui Joseph patrols the forecourt of Beaconsfield recycling centre on the lookout for three gems amongst the junk. For her own project, Jacqui gives a radical revamp to a drop-leaf table that she hopes will produce a profit.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Escape to the Country
channel.desc: It's an emotional homecoming today and a first for Jules Hudson as he visits County Down and County Antrim for some property shopping in Northern Ireland. He's with a couple who want to relocate there after a lifetime spent in Toronto.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Kensuke's Kingdom
channel.desc: Young Michael and his dog wash up on a remote island when a violent storm sweeps them overboard during a sailing trip. Believing he's all alone, Michael is surprised to discover a mysterious Japanese man who's lived on the island since World War II.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Blue Planet II
channel.desc: Celebrating the highlights from the series, from the intense heat of the tropics to the planet's frozen poles, through to its unexplored depths. New worlds and extraordinary never-before-seen animal behaviours are revealed.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Parenthood
channel.desc: A journey like no other - full of moments of joy and danger. For animal parents in the wild, the stakes could not be higher, with success ensuring the future of life on our planet.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Fiona and the team are at Dyffryn Gardens near Cardiff in south Wales. Will Farmer is thrilled to see a huge collection of Clarice Cliff ceramics, including many rarities picked up for just a few pounds, while Hilary Kay is amused by a toy figure of a fire-breathing mother-in-law that shoots real sparks. Alastair Chandler is intrigued by a 1960s 'Atmos' clock that runs on air, and Lisa Lloyd admires an ornate Welsh harp, getting to hear it played by a musician who is keeping the art alive.

channel.name: BBC One NL
channel.title: The Narrow Road to the Deep North
channel.desc: Dorrigo faces a malpractice probe in 1989, forcing flashbacks to his time as a POW in 1943; he recalls a failed amputation, a cholera outbreak, and Rabbit's death.
